description: The round payoff this round was 88. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 44.
The game structure resembles a prisoner's dilemma, where mutual cooperation (option 1) maximizes collective payoff, but individual incentives tempt defection (option 2)
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest individual and joint payoffs, as shown in the 2024-01-02 round where both received 44
Defection (option 2) creates a short-term payoff asymmetry (75% vs. 25% of halved payoff), incentivizing exploitation but risking mutual defection and lower payoffs
Repeated interactions enable trust-building or retaliatory strategies, as actions are revealed each round, influencing future decisions
Coordination on option 1 is Pareto optimal, but requires overcoming the temptation to defect for higher personal gain
